thread.title: The best retro music festivals
thread.title_full: The best retro music festivals - Telegraph

author: Saffron Alexander
title: The best retro music festivals
text: Retro Festival Date: 7 - 9 August 2015 Tickets: Retro Festival Marvel at over 1000 vintage and classical vehicles whilst listening to old school Rock 'n' Roll, 60s club music, and Swing on three different stages. One of Europe's leading rock bands 'The Firebirds' will be performing on Sunday, due to perform the complete specture of your favourite 50s and 60s music, from Rockabilly to Ballads and their own original songs. Summertime Swing Dancers doing the jitterbug (Rex) Date: 2 August 2015 Tickets: Jive Aces Get into the swing of things at the annual Summertime Swing event in Sussex. Performers include the Swedish Queen of Swing, Gunhild Carling , The Rockabellas and the grandson of Bing Crosby, Phil Crosby Jr, promising a nostalgic night on the dancefloor showing off your Jitterbug, West Coast Swing, or Boogie Woogie. Rewind Festival Date: 21- 23 August 2015 Tickets: Rewind Festival The biggest 80s music festival in the world makes its way to Oxfordshire at the end of August showcasing an array of bands and solo artists who had success in the 1980s. This years line-up boasts act such as Billy Ocean , Kim Wilde and the British soul quartet Hot Chocolate . Twinwood Festival Date: 29 - 31 August 2015 Tickets: Twinwood Festival Running for 13 years now, Twinwood is one of the UK's biggest and longest running vintage music and dance festivals. Held every August bank holiday weekend, Twinwood boasts over 60 live bands playing music from the twenties to the sixties and everything between. If you need a break from the music, you can watch comedy shows, burlesque dancers, ogle over classic cars, or enter the Mr & Miss Vintage UK pageant. Whitby 60â€™s Spectacular Date: 25 - 27 September 2015 Tickets: Whitby Live As the name suggests, Whitby 60s Spectacular specialises in music from the swinging sixties and features some of the biggest names from the era. The Merseybeats are headlining the show along with Jimmy and the Vagabonds and the Swinging Blue Jeans. Vintage Festival (Vintage Festival) Date: 5 - 6 Septempber 2015 Tickets: Vintage Festival Celebrating seven decades of British music, dance, fashion, flim, art and design, the Vintage Festival is the place to be if you want to remember all the cultural milestones that made Britain what it is today. From funk to disco, Vintage Festival covers it all. All Star 60s Show Date: Various Tickets: Chimes International Acts including Brian Poole and The Original Tremeloes, The Troggs, and The Pacemakers are set to perform a show that is guaranteed to have you rocking in your seat. Reminisce (Justin Sutcliffe) Date: 19 September 2015 Tickets: Reminisce 70s Club Visage, The Village Boyz and The Funk Collective are on hand to help create an atmosphere that wouldn't seem out of place in the hippie filled, disco loving 70s. Atomic Festival Date: 30 April - 1 May 2016 Tickets: Atomic Festival Offering 1950s Rock 'n' Roll, Rhythym and Blues, Rockabilly bands, and Western Swing in Sywell Aerodrome over the course of two days, Atomic Festival aims to celebrate everything great that came out of the fifties. As well as nostalgia inducing music, they also have a roller rink, a drive in movie theatre and even a classic car show to name just a few of their many attractions over the weekend. Prudential Blues Fest (EPA) Date: 7 - 8 November 2015 Tickets: Prudential Blues Fest An evening with two of music's most legendary performers, Tom Jones and Van Marrison , will see them perform on stage together performing hits from their extensive catalogue of music that spans almost six decades between them. telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegoodlife
